009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive;
011
012import ij.plugin.filter.RankFilters;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianFilterSeparable;
017import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogLabel;
018import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This is an implementation of the adaptive thresholder proposed by Niblack in [1]. See Sec. 9.2.2 of [2] for a
023 * detailed description. It comes in three different version, depending on the type of local support region:
024 * </p>
025 * <ul>
026 * <li>{@link Box}: uses a rectangular (box-shaped) support region;</li>
027 * <li>{@link Disk}: uses a circular (disk-shaped) support region (see [2], Alg.
028 * 9.8);</li>
029 * <li>{@link Gauss}: uses a 2D isotropic Gaussian support region (see [2], Alg.
030 * 9.9 and Prog. 9.2).</li>
031 * </ul>
032 * Note that {@link NiblackThresholder} itself is abstract and thus cannot be
033 * instantiated.
034 * <p>
035 * [1] W. Niblack. "An Introduction to Digital Image Processing". Prentice-Hall
036 * (1986). <br>
037 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
038 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
039 * </p>
040 *
041 * @author WB
042 * @version 2022/08/01
043 */
044public abstract class NiblackThresholder implements AdaptiveThresholder {
045        
046        public enum RegionType { Box, Disk, Gauss }
047        
048        /**
049         * Parameters for class {@link NiblackThresholder}.
050         */
051        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle<NiblackThresholder> {
052                
053                @DialogLabel("Radius")
054                public int radius = 15;
055                
056                @DialogLabel("kappa")
057                public double kappa = 0.30;
058                
059                @DialogLabel("d_min")
060                public int dMin = 5;
061                
062                @DialogLabel("Background mode")
063                public BackgroundMode bgMode = BackgroundMode.DARK;
064        }
065        
066        private final Parameters params;
067        FloatProcessor Imean;
068        FloatProcessor Isigma;
069
070        private NiblackThresholder() {
071                this(new Parameters());
072        }
073
074        private NiblackThresholder(Parameters params) {
075                super();
076                this.params = params;
077        }
078        
079        // method to be implemented by real sub-classes:
080        abstract void makeMeanAndVariance(ByteProcessor I, int radius);
081        
082        @Override
083        public ByteProcessor getThreshold(ByteProcessor I) {
084                final int M = I.getWidth();
085                final int N = I.getHeight();
086                makeMeanAndVariance(I, params.radius);
087                ByteProcessor Q = new ByteProcessor(M, N);
088                final double kappa = params.kappa;
089                final int dMin = params.dMin;
090                final boolean darkBg = (params.bgMode == BackgroundMode.DARK);
091                
092                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
093                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
094                                double sigma = Isigma.getf(u, v);
095                                double mu = Imean.getf(u, v);
096                                double diff = kappa * sigma + dMin;
097                                int q = (int) Math.rint((darkBg) ? mu + diff : mu - diff);
098                                if (q < 0)       q = 0;
099                                if (q > 255) q = 255;
100                                Q.set(u, v, q);
101                        }
102                }
103                return Q;
104        }
105        
106        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
107        
108        /**
109         * Static convenience method for creating a {@link NiblackThresholder} with
110         * a specific support region type.
111         * Note that {@link NiblackThresholder} itself is abstract and cannot be instantiated
112         * (see concrete sub-types {@link Box}, {@link Disk}, {@link Gauss}).
113         * 
114         * @param regType support region type
115         * @param params other parameters
116         * @return an instance of {@link NiblackThresholder}
117         */
118        public static NiblackThresholder create(RegionType regType, Parameters params) {
119                switch (regType) {
120                case Box :              return new NiblackThresholder.Box(params);
121                case Disk :     return new NiblackThresholder.Disk(params);
122                case Gauss : return new NiblackThresholder.Gauss(params);
123                default :               return null;
124                }
125        }
126        
127        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
128        
129        /**
130         * Implementation of Niblack's adaptive thresholder using a
131         * rectangular (box-shaped) support region 
132         * (concrete implementation of abstract class {@link NiblackThresholder}).
133         */
134        public static class Box extends NiblackThresholder {
135
136                /**
137                 * Constructor using default parameters.
138                 */
139                public Box() {
140                        super();
141                }
142                
143                /**
144                 * Constructor with specific parameters.
145                 * @param params parameters
146                 */
147                public Box(Parameters params) {
148                        super(params);
149                }
150
151                @Override
152                void makeMeanAndVariance(ByteProcessor I, int radius) {
153                        int M = I.getWidth();
154                        int N = I.getHeight();
155                        Imean =  new FloatProcessor(M, N);
156                        Isigma =  new FloatProcessor(M, N);
157                        final int n = (radius + 1 + radius) * (radius + 1 + radius);
158
159                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
160                                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
161                                        long A = 0;     // sum of image values in support region
162                                        long B = 0;     // sum of squared image values in support region
163                                        for (int j = -radius; j <= radius; j++) {
164                                                for (int i = -radius; i <= radius; i++) {
165                                                        int p = getPaddedPixel(I, u + i, v + j); // this is slow!
166                                                        A = A + p;
167                                                        B = B + p * p;
168                                                }
169                                        }
170                                        Imean.setf(u, v, (float) A / n);
171                                        Isigma.setf(u, v, (float) Math.sqrt((B - (double) (A * A) / n) / n));
172                                }
173                        }
174                }
175                
176                // TODO: change to use an ImageAccessor!
177                private int getPaddedPixel(ByteProcessor bp, int u, int v) {
178                        final int w = bp.getWidth();
179                        final int h = bp.getHeight();
180                        if (u < 0)
181                                u = 0;
182                        else if (u >= w)
183                                u = w - 1;
184                        if (v < 0)
185                                v = 0;
186                        else if (v >= h)
187                                v = h - 1;
188                        return bp.get(u, v);
189                }
190                
191        }
192        
193        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
194        
195        /**
196         * Implementation of Niblack's adaptive thresholder using a
197         * circular (disk-shaped) support region 
198         * (concrete implementation of abstract class {@link NiblackThresholder}).
199         */
200        public static class Disk extends NiblackThresholder {
201                
202                /**
203                 * Constructor using default parameters.
204                 */
205                public Disk() {
206                        super();
207                }
208                
209                /**
210                 * Constructor with specific parameters.
211                 * @param params parameters
212                 */
213                public Disk(Parameters params) {
214                        super(params);
215                }
216
217                @Override
218                void makeMeanAndVariance(ByteProcessor I, int radius) {
219                        FloatProcessor mean = (FloatProcessor) I.convertToFloat();
220                        FloatProcessor var =  (FloatProcessor) mean.duplicate();
221                        
222                        RankFilters rf = new RankFilters();
223                        rf.rank(mean, radius, RankFilters.MEAN);
224                        Imean = mean;
225                        
226                        rf.rank(var, radius, RankFilters.VARIANCE);
227                        var.sqrt();
228                        Isigma = var;
229                }
230        }
231        
232        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
233        
234        /**
235         * Implementation of Niblack's adaptive thresholder using a
236         * 2D Gaussian support region 
237         * (concrete implementation of abstract class {@link NiblackThresholder}).
238         */
239        public static class Gauss extends NiblackThresholder {
240                
241                /**
242                 * Constructor using default parameters.
243                 */
244                public Gauss() {
245                        super();
246                }
247                
248                /**
249                 * Constructor with specific parameters.
250                 * @param params parameters
251                 */
252                public Gauss(Parameters params) {
253                        super(params);
254                }
255                
256                @Override
257                void makeMeanAndVariance(ByteProcessor I, int r) {
258                        // //uses ImageJ's GaussianBlur
259                        // local variance over square of size (size + 1 + size)^2
260                        int M = I.getWidth();
261                        int N = I.getHeight();
262                        
263                        Imean = new FloatProcessor(M,N);
264                        Isigma = new FloatProcessor(M,N);
265
266                        FloatProcessor A = I.convertToFloatProcessor();
267                        FloatProcessor B = I.convertToFloatProcessor();
268                        B.sqr();
269                        
270                        double sigma = r * 0.6; // sigma of Gaussian filter should be approx. 0.6 of the disk's radius
271                        
272//                      GaussianBlur gb = new GaussianBlur();
273//                      gb.blurFloat(A, sigma, sigma, 0.002);
274//                      gb.blurFloat(B, sigma, sigma, 0.002);
275                        
276                        GenericFilter gaussian = new GaussianFilterSeparable(sigma);
277                        gaussian.applyTo(A);
278                        gaussian.applyTo(B);
279
280                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
281                                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
282                                        float a = A.getf(u, v);
283                                        float b = B.getf(u, v);
284                                        float sigmaG = (float) Math.sqrt(b - a * a);
285                                        Imean.setf(u, v, a);
286                                        Isigma.setf(u, v, sigmaG);
287                                }
288                        }
289                }
290        }
291        
292}
